page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF GRID 03200693
page.content: The area is divided by the valley of the River Ore,with the land rising gently from the river. On the south side of the river are the villages of Cardenden and Dundonald,on the north side,Bowhill and Auchterderran.In the past,the population was almost wholly employed in local coal mines.During the late 60's and early 70's the coal industry contracted,as a result, the villages are no more than dormitory settlements.Large tracts of land are spoiled by derelict mining buildings and pit bings.The Regional Council have plans to reclaim this lsnd for agriculture in 1988/93. In the surrounding countryside mixed farming is practised.On the eastern side of the area,the Forestry Commission has plantations of spruce,pines and larch.
